replies.body:
Well, obviously, the reliance on "common sense" is insufficient and this "clear line" is still hazy and vague, considering we're actually having an argument over what counts as "Avicus-related" and what doesn't.

An apology for something directly pertinent to the server, coupled with less relevant information, is nonetheless, at least marginally, "Avicus-related". If you were to ignore the tangential, unrelated half of the post — which you easily could, and therefore should — would it not be "perfectly fine"? There have been countless other threads in the past as well, where people discussed personal updates that, normally, would warrant a lock, yet they managed to get by for whatever reason, be it popularity in the community, pity from others, or (such as in this case) adding a remark or two about the server. One thread gets archived, another is allowed to remain; this disorganization and lack of consistency constitutes why players cry "bias" so often.
